channel.title: Help with deleting objects.. not what you think
channel.description:
Hi, im th3h1tm4n, ryan, dont care wat u call me. Erm... i normaly stick with clients so im not to good with servers... I have added a few models onto my client and i want to create an area using them. I know how to add global objects but first i want to delete all existing global objects within a certain area. There is about 900 squares in the area that need deleteing. I was wondering if anyone had a code to delete in a range of cordinates.. or if someone had a command to delete them like ::deleteobjects coordX coodY.
These are the cordinates and i need everything within the square to be deleted..
delete everything from coords
x = 2501 to 2535 y = 3355 to 3388
thank you :)[br][size=1]Posted on: November 18, 2007, 03:07:57 PM[/size][hr]anyone?

item.title: Help with deleting objects.. not what you think
item.dc:creator: @th3h1tm4n th3h1tm4n
item.description:
@th3h1tm4n wrote:

lol thanks princess but i already new that way… i actauly want to delete everything inside those cordinates and not have to write out

	deletethatobject(####, ####); //obj

900 times… do you know how i can?

Read full topic
item.source: Help with deleting objects.. not what you think

item.title: Help with deleting objects.. not what you think
item.dc:creator: @ChemicalReaction1 ChemicalReaction™
item.description:
@ChemicalReaction1 wrote:

Lol pro coders… as i said :

[quote=“ChemicalReaction™, post:4, topic:159159”]Dont be a moron. that would delete anything that was added there aswell. so if you add a global object it would just delete it.

and to answer you’re question you need to replace objects. there should be a void in your client.java for it.[/quote]

Read full topic

Well there are 2 ways

Meyb it will be a good task for Pro coders

item.title: Help with deleting objects.. not what you think
item.dc:creator: @ChemicalReaction1 ChemicalReaction™
item.description:
@ChemicalReaction1 wrote:

Dont be a moron. that would delete anything that was added there aswell. so if you add a global object it would just delete it.

and to answer you’re question you need to replace objects. there should be a void in your client.java for it.

Read full topic

item.title: Help with deleting objects.. not what you think
item.dc:creator: @system system
item.description:
@system wrote:

Ok i won’t work for u :)) bikoz thats allot of objects to delete…
I could show u how to delete em… bot only 1 by 1

[b]Go to your client java and search for :

public void deletethatobject(int objectX, int objectY) {

And under u should see some thing like this

public void deletethatwall(int objectX, int objectY) { ReplaceObject2(objectX, objectY, 6951, -1, 0); } public void AddObject(int objectX, int objectY, int NewObjectID, int Face) { outStream.createFrameVarSizeWord(60); outStream.writeByte(objectY - (mapRegionY * 8)); outStream.writeByteC(objectX - (mapRegionX * 8)); /*CREATE OBJECT*/ if (NewObjectID > -1) { outStream.writeByte(151); outStream.writeByteS(0); outStream.writeWordBigEndian(NewObjectID); outStream.writeByteA(Face); //0= WEST | -1 = NORTH | -2 = EAST | -3 = SOUTH } outStream.endFrameVarSizeWord(); } public void makeGlobalObject(int x, int y, int typeID, int orientation, int tileObjectType){ //Makes Global objects for (Player p : server.playerHandler.players){ if(p != null){ client person = (client)p; if((person.playerName != null || person.playerName != "null")){ if(person.distanceToPoint(x, y) <= 60){ person.createNewTileObject(x, y, typeID, orientation, tileObjectType); } } } } }

Remember only under that aftar that code u shuld see some thing like that

		deletethatobject(2632, 3341); //obj

Okk now add

deletethatobject(####, ####); //obj ( in # add cordinates)

When u have done it compile and run

Ok now i helped u now u help me…
What shuld i use to open models?

Read full topic
